How do I initiate a currency launch on the Verus network, and what are the requirements for doing so? Additionally, how can I convert VRSCTEST to the newly launched currency, and what are the implications of this conversion?

To initiate a currency launch on the Verus network, you need to fund the currency with at least 10 VRSCTEST and have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at a specified rate (in this case, 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD) in order to launch. This process is part of the mining process, and mining the blocks that launch a currency earns the 0.025% conversion fees of participation in the launch, converting VRSCTEST to the new currency.

Before the block where the new currency (GOLD in this example) launches, you can send a command to park your conversion until the token launches. This command would look like this:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
This command effectively parks your conversion until the token launches, at which point, you will either find the converted amount of GOLD in your wallet, or you will have your VRSCTEST back.

After the currency launches, you can create a new token (mycoin in this example) that can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST. The process of creating this new token involves defining its properties and conversion rates using the `definecurrency` command.

It's worth noting that, currently, the only way to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option. However, the Verus network provides a flexible and decentralized platform for creating and managing currencies, allowing for a wide range of use cases and applications.
